definition: to block sb's path/to obstruct/to flag down (a taxi)
to cut off (a length)/to stop/to intercept/section/chunk/length

sentences.english: This functionality would also address problems with pop-up blockers.
sentences.chinese: 该功能还会解决弹出拦截器问题。

sentences.english: The aircraft uses the Foxhunter multi-mode air-intercept radar to detect and target hostile aircraft.
sentences.chinese: 该机采用福克斯特多模空中拦截雷达探测和目标敌机。

sentences.english: Moreover, shot-range and long-range interceptions are performed in simulations.
sentences.chinese: 最后对长程与短程拦截问题进行了数值仿真。

sentences.english: So essentially we are trying to intercept the interceptor.
sentences.chinese: 因此本质上我们正在试图拦截拦截器。

sentences.english: So essentially we are trying to intercept the interceptor.
sentences.chinese: 因此本质上我们正在试图拦截拦截器。

sentences.english: You should nail his truck before he drives up the mountains.
sentences.chinese: 在他把车开进山里之前，你得设法把他的卡车拦截住。

sentences.english: The third baseman made some remarkable stops.
sentences.chinese: 第三垒守垒员做了一些不可思议的拦截。

sentences.english: Have you ever been stopped for speeding?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有因超超速曾被人拦截？

sentences.english: Opponents will turn hesitation into complete obstruction.
sentences.chinese: 拦截者又尽没有犹豫天将入进完备壅闭。

sentences.english: Intercepting and changing this value could expose sensitive financial information about other customers.
sentences.chinese: 拦截和修改这个值可能暴露其他客户的敏感财务信息。

sentences.english: The first interceptor they announce is a mid course one.
sentences.chinese: 他们的首个拦截导弹系统竟然是导弹中段拦截。

sentences.english: The first interceptor they announce is a mid course one.
sentences.chinese: 他们的首个拦截导弹系统竟然是导弹中段拦截。

sentences.english: Each interceptor will carry an EKV in its tip.
sentences.chinese: 每一枚拦截弹都会在顶部携带一架EKV。
一款非常直观的广告拦截器。

sentences.english: Please make sure you turn off your pop-up blocker.
sentences.chinese: 请确保您关闭您的弹出窗口拦截器。

sentences.english: Corrected wall blocker issue in the Hubologist base.
sentences.chinese: 在Hubologist更正墙基拦截器的问题。

definition: to stop/to obstruct/to bar the way
to intercept/to cut off and capture
to attack/to accuse/to charge/an attack (terrorist or military)
to investigate a crime/to scout/to reconnoiter/reconnaissance/detection/a scout
to start out on a trip/to dispatch troops
sudden and violent attack/assault/fig. rushed job/concentrated effort to finish a job quickly
